item.title: Brexit or Not, EU is One Pig's Breakfast Served Lukewarm
item.description:
Brexit or Not, EU is One Pig's Breakfast Served Lukewarm

Remember Grexit? Think back a bit when the whole world was on their seat's edge and wondering if Greece will or if they won't exit the European Union. Well fast forward to today and here we are wondering the same about the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.

item.title: Bitcoin Looks Beyond Brexit As New Opportunities Emerge
item.description:
Bitcoin Looks Beyond Brexit As New Opportunities Emerge

For Bitcoin, the Brexit poll couldn't have come at a more uneasy time but some good developments are taking place on the sideline. The digital currency has been in and out of an almost three-week low on Thursday June 23 at around the $580 range which is quite worrying especially for those who still cringe in anticipation of a smooth ride as they step into its world.

item.title: Bitcoin Crashes as Australian Auction Closes
item.description:
Bitcoin Crashes as Australian Auction Closes

Bitcoin reached a low of $550 last night, down by more than one hundred dollars from $680 for the third day in a row. The unexpected crash coincides with the end of the first Australian Bitcoin Auction which closed around the same time as bitcoin's price movement.

item.title: Soros Backs Gold to Hedge Against EU Collapse, Bitcoin Joins Gold As Brexit Hedge
item.description:
Soros Backs Gold to Hedge Against EU Collapse, Bitcoin Joins Gold As Brexit Hedge

Fearing a possible EU collapse, and attempting to diversify away from a volatile dollar, billionaire George Soros has begun heavily investing in gold stocks. According to a Wall Street Journal article, Soros Fund Management, the $30 billion fund which oversees Soros's investments, made a series of large investments into precious metals.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Rises Sharply After the UK Votes to Leave the EU, Trading Volumes Big
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Rises Sharply After the UK Votes to Leave the EU, Trading Volumes Big

The Bitcoin market has welcomed the outcome of the Brexit vote in the UK with open arms as the price of its currency soars following a falling trend in recent days. The price of Bitcoin dipped to as low as $583 just before the June 23 Brexit voting day - a sharp drop from its two-and-a-half year high of nearly $775 on June 17.

item.title: The Future of Ether: Ethereum Miners to Decide on DAO Rescue Fix
item.description:
The Future of Ether: Ethereum Miners to Decide on DAO Rescue Fix

Ethereum stakeholders are set to secure their future and prevent a repeat of the June 17 attack as they are bound to decide on a DAO rescue fix. On Tuesday June 21, Ethereum announced the release of DAO Rescue HotFix 1.2.8, with the critical Ethereum soft-fork update aimed to rescue the stolen DAO funds.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Rises Sharply After the UK Votes to Leave the EU, Trading Volumes Big
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Rises Sharply After the UK Votes to Leave the EU, Trading Volumes Big

The Bitcoin market has welcomed the outcome of the Brexit vote in the UK with open arms as the price of its currency soars following a falling trend in recent days. The price of Bitcoin dipped to as low as $583 just before the June 23 Brexit voting day - a sharp drop from its two-and-a-half year high of nearly $775 on June 17.

item.title: Rise of Bitcoin and Gold as Brexit Turns into Reality
item.description:
Rise of Bitcoin and Gold as Brexit Turns into Reality

The Brexit referendum results are out. With the majority voting to Leave, the global markets have dropped while the Bitcoin and Gold futures register a rise. We finally have some closure with regard to Britain leaving the European Union.

item.title: Bitcoin value spikes in wake of EU referendum
item.description:
Bitcoin value spikes in wake of EU referendum

The value of bitcoin rose sharply today as Sterling dipped in response to the UK's decision to leave the European Union. The cryptocurrency's price against the dollar rose by more than $100 to its highest point in over two years.

item.title: Online Retailers Immediately Impacted By Brexit Outcome
item.description:
Online Retailers Immediately Impacted By Brexit Outcome

The Brexit is affecting all of the United Kingdom as we speak. The region voted for a new era, and they will also have to deal with the consequences of that decision. Various UK webshops have temporarily closed their online doors, as they need a "time-out".
